column6: The 2017 season of the Indian Premier League, also known as IPL 10 and branded as Vivo IPL 2017, was the tenth edition of the IPL

column2: Individual tournament (like IPL 2017, 16, 15, World Cup 2011,15,09... etc)
column6: The 2016 season of the Indian Premier League, also known as IPL 9, and branded as Vivo IPL 2016 for sponsorship reasons, was the ninth season of the IPL

column2: Individual tournament (like IPL 2017, 16, 15, World Cup 2011,15,09... etc)
column6: The 2011 Indian Premier League season, abbreviated as IPL 4 or the IPL 2011, was the fourth season of the Indian Premier League, the top Twenty20 cricket league in India

column2: Individual tournament (like IPL 2017, 16, 15, World Cup 2011,15,09... etc)
column6: The 2010 Indian Premier League season, abbreviated as IPL 3 or the 2010 IPL, was the third season of the Indian Premier League

column2: Individual tournament (like IPL 2017, 16, 15, World Cup 2011,15,09... etc)
column6: The 2015 ICC Cricket World Cup was the 11th Cricket World Cup, jointly hosted by Australia and New Zealand

column2: Individual tournament (like IPL 2017, 16, 15, World Cup 2011,15,09... etc)
column6: The 2011 ICC Cricket World Cup was the tenth Cricket World Cup. It was played in India, Sri Lanka, and (for the first time) Bangladesh

column2: Individual tournament (like IPL 2017, 16, 15, World Cup 2011,15,09... etc)
column6: The 2007 Cricket World Cup (officially known as ICC Cricket World Cup 2007) was the 9th edition of the Cricket World Cup tournament that took place in the West Indies from 13 March to 28 April 2007, using the sport's One Day International (ODI) format.

column2: Individual tournament (like IPL 2017, 16, 15, World Cup 2011,15,09... etc)
column6: The 2003 Cricket World Cup was the eighth Cricket World Cup, organized by the International Cricket Council (ICC). It was co-hosted by South Africa, Zimbabwe and Kenya.

column2: Individual tournament (like IPL 2017, 16, 15, World Cup 2011,15,09... etc)
column6: The 1999 Cricket World Cup was the seventh edition of the Cricket World Cup, organised by the International Cricket Council (ICC). It was hosted primarily by England, with some games being played in Scotland, Ireland, Wales and the Netherlands.

column2: Individual tournament (like IPL 2017, 16, 15, World Cup 2011,15,09... etc)
column6: The 1996 Cricket World Cup, also called the Wills World Cup 1996 after its official sponsors, ITC's Wills brand, was the sixth Cricket World Cup. It was the second World Cup to be hosted by Pakistan and India, and for the first time by Sri Lanka.

column2: Individual tournament (like IPL 2017, 16, 15, World Cup 2011,15,09... etc)
column6: The 1983 Cricket World Cup (officially the Prudential Cup '83) was the 3rd edition of the Cricket World Cup tournament. It was held from 9 June to 25 June 1983 in England and Wales and was won by India.
column92: No man of the series awarded in 1983

column2: Individual tournament (like IPL 2017, 16, 15, World Cup 2011,15,09... etc)
column6: The 1987 Cricket World Cup (known as the Reliance Cup 1987 for sponsorship reasons) was the fourth edition of the ICC Cricket World Cup tournament. It was held from 8 October to 8 November 1987 in India and Pakistan.
column92: No man of the series awarded in 1987

column2: Individual tournament (like IPL 2017, 16, 15, World Cup 2011,15,09... etc)
column6: The 1992 Cricket World Cup (officially the Benson & Hedges World Cup 1992) was the fifth staging of the Cricket World Cup, organised by the International Cricket Council (ICC). It was held in Australia and New Zealand from 22 February to 25 March 1992 and finished with Pakistan beating England in the final to become the World Cup champions for the first time.

column2: Individual tournament (like IPL 2017, 16, 15, World Cup 2011,15,09... etc)
column6: The 2019 Cricket World Cup (officially ICC Cricket World Cup 2019) is the 12th edition of the Cricket World Cup, scheduled to be hosted by England and Wales, from 30 May to 14 July 2019.

column2: Individual tournament (like IPL 2017, 16, 15, World Cup 2011,15,09... etc)
column6: The 1975 Cricket World Cup (officially called the Prudential Cup '75) was the first edition of the Cricket World Cup, organised by the International Cricket Conference (ICC) and was the first major limited overs One Day International (ODI) cricket tournament to be held. It was held from 7 to 21 June 1975 in England.
column92: No 'Man of the Series' was awarded in 1975.

column2: Individual tournament (like IPL 2017, 16, 15, World Cup 2011,15,09... etc)
column6: The 1979 Cricket World Cup (officially the Prudential Cup '79) was the second edition of the Cricket World Cup and was won by the West Indies, who had also won the inaugural tournament four years earlier. It was held in England from 9 to 23 June 1979.

column2: Individual tournament (like IPL 2017, 16, 15, World Cup 2011,15,09... etc)
column6: The 2008 Indian Premier League season was the inaugural season of the Indian Premier League, established by the BCCI in 2007. The season commenced on 18 April 2008 with the final match held on 1 June 2008. The competition started with a double round robin group stage, in which each of the 8 teams played a home match and an away match against every other team. These matches were followed by two semi-finals and a final.

column2: Individual tournament (like IPL 2017, 16, 15, World Cup 2011,15,09... etc)
column6: The 2009 Indian Premier League season, abbreviated as IPL 2 or the 2009 IPL, was the second season of the Indian Premier League, established by the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) in 2007. The tournament was hosted by South Africa and was played between 18 April and 24 May 2009.

column2: Individual tournament (like IPL 2017, 16, 15, World Cup 2011,15,09... etc)
column6: The 2012 Indian Premier League season, abbreviated as IPL 5 or the IPL 2012 or the DLF IPL 2012 (owing to title sponsorship reasons), was the fifth season of the Indian Premier League, initiated by the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI). The tournament began on 4 April and ended on 27 May 2012. Kolkata Knight Riders were the winning team.

column2: Individual tournament (like IPL 2017, 16, 15, World Cup 2011,15,09... etc)
column6: The 2013 season of the Indian Premier League, abbreviated as IPL 6 or Pepsi IPL 2013, was the sixth season of the IPL, established by the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) . The tournament was held from 3 April to 26 May 2013. Mumbai Indians won the tournament for the first time.

column2: Individual tournament (like IPL 2017, 16, 15, World Cup 2011,15,09... etc)
column6: The 2014 season of the Indian Premier League, abbreviated as IPL 7 or Pepsi IPL 2014, was the seventh season of the IPL. The tournament featured eight teams, one fewer than in 2013 after the withdrawal of the Pune Warriors India. It was held from 16 April 2014 to 1 June 2014.

column2: Individual tournament (like IPL 2017, 16, 15, World Cup 2011,15,09... etc)
column6: The 2015 season of the Indian Premier League, abbreviated as IPL 8 or Pepsi IPL 2015, was the eighth season of the IPL, a Twenty20 cricket league. The tournament featured eight teams and was held from 8 April 2015 to 24 May 2015.

column2: Individual tournament (like IPL 2017, 16, 15, World Cup 2011,15,09... etc)
column6: The 2018 season of the Indian Premier League, also known as IPL 11, was the eleventh season of the IPL, a professional Twenty20 cricket league. The season, which was held from 7 April to 27 May, saw the return of the Chennai Super Kings and the Rajasthan Royals after serving two years of suspension.
